poem:
"Unassuming Unicorns"

Imagined steeds-
no bridle can contain-
Spiral horns of dreams
pierce the mundane.

Healing
in their gentle gait,
yet fierce as roaring tales
at ancient gates.

An untouched myth
we've come to know,
mirroring our hopes,
in their spectral glow.

Velvet visions
etched in time,
resilient echoes,
beautifully sublime.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Beautiful and resilient’: exhibition explores cultural history of unicorns Across two millennia, the unicorn has accumulated a wealth of symbolism reflecting the preoccupations of the ages. But two qualities remain consistent – that the fantastical horse-like creature with a single, spiralling horn protruding from its forehead is impossible to capture and that it possesses an extraordinary capacity to heal. From the Roman author Pliny’s description of a beast with a bellowing roar, through its choice". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
